CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Language
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​CommentFinder
public
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Language
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​CSharp
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​Perl
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​Python
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​Ruby
CodeClear.​NaturalDocs.​Engine.​Languages.​Parsers.​ShebangScript

A class encapsulating information about a language.  This differs from ConfigFileLanguage in that its meant to represent the final combined settings of a language rather than its entry in a config file.  For example, this class doesn't store the language's extensions or shebang strings.

Multithreading: Thread Safety Notes

Once the object is set up, meaning there will be no further changes to properties like <LineCommentStrings>, the object can be used by multiple threads to parse multiple files simultaneously.  The parsing functions store no state information inside the object.

Types
EnumValues
public enum EnumValues : byte

Can be Global, UnderType, or UnderParent.

LanguageType
public enum LanguageType : byte

The type of language or file this is.

FullSupport

The language is fully supported.

BasicSupport

The language has basic support.

TextFile

The file is a text file.

Container

The file is a container, meaning it's contents may contain code from other languages, such as .cgi and .asp files.

LanguageFlags
[Flags]
protected enum LanguageFlags : byte
InSystemFile

Set if the language was defined in the system config file Languages.txt.

InProjectFile

Set if the language was defined in the project config file Languages.txt.  Not set for Alter Language.

InConfigFiles

A combination of InSystemFile and InProjectFile used for testing if either are set.

InBinaryFile

Set if the language was present in Languages.nd

Predefined

Set if the language is predefined by Natural Docs.

GenerateAlternateCommentStyles
public void GenerateAlternateCommentStyles ()

If the language has basic support and they're not already defined, generate <JavadocLineCommentStringPairs>, <JavadocBlockCommentStringPairs>, and <XMLLineCommentStrings> automatically from <BlockCommentStringPairs> and <LineCommentStrings>.

Flags

These properties do not affect the equality operators.
